column4: anyone else have any ideas on the problem executing the bin file?
what's the problem? can't execute it? error messages?
it's not ECS.bin or Ecs.bin? linux is case sensitive
can you do a pastebin with the output from "ls -l" <-- that's an lower case L and from "./ecs.bin"
pay attention.. the output from ls -l
hmm... everything looks alright..  sure it's not just a silly typo or something? where is this file located? some weird external drive? ntfs-drive?
very strange.. there must be something obvious we're missing here..
perhaps you should run a fsck on the hard drive
yes.. since you can see the file with ls but not run it or get info about it
I think fsck just runs the second command so it wouldn't really matter which one you use
